issue.title: Possible frame error in simulated GPS velocity generation

content.raw:
Hi Jonathan,

I think I am tracking now.  I believe this issue is that…

* The Hector GPS Gazebo plugin produces GPS velocities in NWU.
* The nmea\_navsat\_driver reports velocities in ENU \(I looked at the wiki page, but it didn’t seem to be explicit\)
* Therefore, if a user was using the hector plugin in simulation and the nmea\_navsat\_driver on the physical robot they would have inconsistent GPS velocity information.

Would one work around be to have a small translator node that converted the `fix_velocity` topic \(Vector3 stamped\) from the Gazebo plugin in NWU, to the `vel` topic \(Twist\) in ENU?  Then it the message types and coord. frame conventions would be compatible with robot\_localization?
content.html:
Hi Jonathan,

I think I am tracking now. I believe this issue is that…

  • The Hector GPS Gazebo plugin produces GPS velocities in NWU.
  • The nmea_navsat_driver reports velocities in ENU (I looked at the wiki page, but it didn’t seem to be explicit)
  • Therefore, if a user was using the hector plugin in simulation and the nmea_navsat_driver on the physical robot they would have inconsistent GPS velocity information.

Would one work around be to have a small translator node that converted the fix_velocity topic (Vector3 stamped) from the Gazebo plugin in NWU, to the vel topic (Twist) in ENU? Then it the message types and coord. frame conventions would be compatible with robot_localization?
